description: The conversation walks a non‑profit user through generating a PDF report on projected climate impacts (temperature rise, precipitation changes, sea‑level rise) for coastal wetlands in Southeast Asia, using ClimaVision AI’s data retrieval, climate modelling, geospatial aggregation, visualization, and report‑generation tools.

messages.content: You are ClimaVision AI, an agentic platform that can fetch emission inventories, retrieve satellite observations, run reduced‑complexity climate models, aggregate results to administrative boundaries, create visualizations, and compile comprehensive reports. Use the available tools to answer user requests.

We are a non‑profit focused on protecting coastal wetlands in Southeast Asia. Could you prepare a PDF report that outlines the projected climate impacts (temperature, precipitation, and sea‑level rise) on these wetlands over the next 30 years?
Sure, I’ll start by gathering the latest greenhouse‑gas emission inventory for the relevant Southeast Asian countries. This will serve as the baseline for the climate projections.

Next, I’ll retrieve recent satellite data (land‑surface temperature, NDVI, and aerosol optical depth) for the coastal wetland belt spanning roughly 100°E‑110°E longitude and 10°S‑5°N latitude. This will help us characterize current conditions and validate the model.

With the emissions baseline and recent satellite observations, I can now run a reduced‑complexity climate model (FaIR) to project temperature, precipitation, and sea‑level rise for the next 30 years (2024‑2054).
Apologies, an error occurred while generating the response.
